content.description: The crux is a requisite (?) handjam located at about 15 feet off the deck.
content.location:
This goes up the crack about 10 feet to the left of

The Alive Dyno

.

content.description:
Start left around the corner and below

V0 Crack

at sandy huecos, and climb up and onto the large ledge above.
content.protection: Pads and perhaps a spotter for the ridge of rock just off the landing area.
content.location:
Go uphill along the main wall, and this will be on your left just before a large step up leading to

V0 Crack

. It climbs the face and tops out the large ledge on the left side of

V0 Crack

.

content.description: This sweet problem goes up the bulge to the right of the big triangular wall. Start out on an undercling, then bust some big moves to a horn at about 17 feet. Now the fun part: high step and get established on the slab. I would recommend not falling from here.
content.location: This is across from the southeast side of the main boulder.

climbs.name: Thing Behind The Wedge aka The Hangboard

content.description: Start underneath the bulge and move up to a huge pocket, then bust out right to a jug.  Match and work up the mellow dihedral to the top. Be careful of fragile holds up high!
content.location: Start directly below the slabby dihedral on the main wall, about 10 feet or so to the right of the overhanging arete.  It's right behind the Cube and the Wedge Boulders.

content.description:
Start on the

Overhanging Arete

hold and traverse left under the arete to holds that allow you to go up the center of the rock face just left of the

Left Overhanging Arete's

dyno.  Again, the footwork on the rock seems silly/contrived; however, some cool beta makes it fun enough to mention and it is a separate line from the

Overhanging Arete

problems.

Grab the good side-pull, directly under the starting hold for

Overhanging Arete

with your left hand and the fragile side-pull flake 5 ft. opposite with your right. Work your feet up to a good launching pad, and throw a big left up to a large hueco and match hands. Stem your feet up, and make a huge throw with your right to a sandy sloper up and right of the hueco (the higher you grab the less it slopes). Top out on easy ground.
content.location:
This is immediately RIGHT of

Overhanging Arete

.

content.description: This nice warm-up follows a prominent rail along the wall. Start near the "KNS" tag and move right using good holds. When you reach the flake work your way up to the top or continue past the crack.

This is the slopey problem that is located at the bottom Northeast end of the Main Wall. It starts on a flake and goes out the slopey arete. You can either top out right or left. Both seem to be V6 but the left seems a tad bit harder.

Start on the same hold as the

Overhanging Arete

, but move left under the arete onto sandy crimps.  From the higher crimps, make a blind dyno to a large, sloping pocket.  Go straight up from there.  The feet/beginning on this is pretty contrived, and you may feel a little stupid (keep'em high on the vertical part of the sandstone skirt).  However, the dyno is fun and the moves to establish and topout are difficult.

The KNS traverse begins as

The Rail

, but instead of following it up to top out, drop below it and begin a tough traverse all the way to the right side terminus of the wall.  Stay below the lip on the sandy slopers and crimps and keep your feet high on the sandy skirt of rock.  The crux is near the end.  Topout to feel a sense of completion.

The route can also be done in reverse starting on the farthest right crimps and is best if you finish by topping out

The Rail

.  The reverse version ending into

The Rail

topout is V7/8.
content.protection: Although the ground isn't far, you can fall awkwardly and the slope and slippery sand doesn't help.  A few pads at high risk spots or just a spotter and a pad should be enough.

content.description: Start on hand holds at about chest height. Paste your feet on and huck to the large hueco hold about 7 feet up. Plenty of holds to top out with after that.
content.location: This is directly to the right of the second crack on the main wall when walking uphill. It starts to the left of the rail.
